item.title: Fan, 07/31, Inktober 2021
item.description: I’ve been a Nintendo fan since I was 7 years old and my bro bought a SNES. Over the last decade the Nintendo 3DS has become a contender for my all-time favourite console. This is my SNES edition 3DS XL and it’s one of my most treasured belongings! ü§ì Source: from life.

item.title: Art Festival
item.description: Chapel Allerton (my local area) had it’s annual art festival. Me and a few friends went along and enjoyed some music, art and did a little sketching. Very rough and ready but I was too busy having a good time!

item.title: Quick sketch of Neil
item.description: Quick from life sketch of Neil as he watched an episode of RPDR

item.title: Museum sketching
item.description: Met up with some friends today and spent the afternoon chatting away whilst doing some sketching at the Leeds City Museum. This was a statue of Dorothy Una Ratcliffe (A Yorkshire poet). It was made out of dark stone and I loved the way the light was bouncing off it. After the first sketch we sketched a plant in the cafe whilst sipping hot choclates.

item.title: Homemade Christmas Cards!
item.description: One November Saturday morning I did this Santa drawing with the idea to make our first ever homemade Christmas Cards! Neil came up with a poem for the inside of the cards. The hardest bit was I stuck 10 little gem stickers on each of the baubles to give them a bit of sparkle. I ended up sticking over 1000 gems on with tweasers! üòÖ We chose to support two very deserving charities: Mermaids & UK black pride.

item.title: Random portraits
item.description: Off the back of Inktober some friends and I started doing our own weekly prompts. I thought i’d try portraiture (with mixed results!). 10/11/20 “Donald Duck” 18/11/20 “Moving on” 24/11/20 “Fall”

item.title: Inktober warm-up
item.description: I’ve not done any drawing for over year so this is a warm up before inktober starts tomorrow! A very quick sketch of a tissue packet balancing on my knees in bed.

item.title: Dad's birthday
item.description: I did this portrait of my dad for his birthday, I had it printed on his card. I spent longer on this than the usual daily sketches. It took a little over a week, doing an hour or two each day. Source: A photo I took of him at a pub in Whitby.

item.title: Playing around with my new stylus
item.description: I finally got a sylus! Found one the one I need for my tablet (Pixel) on sale in a Dixons at the airport! ü•≥ Quick sketch on the …erm …üöΩ If that wasn’t bad enough, those our my pants! üòÖ Messing around with my new stylus in bed! üõèüé®
